required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Tests: Nasopharyngeal Swab vs Saliva Collected With Salivette® Cortisol for Viral RNA Sampling for RT-qPCR
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 Tests: a Systematic Comparison of Viral RNA Test Sample Taking for RT-qPCR, in This Case With a Nasopharyngeal Swab or Saliva Collected With Salivette® Cortisol, to Diagnose SARS-CoV-2 Virus Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the tests is to establish saliva collection with Salivette® Cortisol.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2-RNA detectability in Swab and Salivette samples.

primary_outcome.measure: SARS-CoV-2-RNA detectability in Swab and Salivette samples

intervention.intervention_name: Sampling of SARS-CoV-2 RNA from nasopharyngeal swab specimen or saliva collected via Salivette Cortisol
intervention.description: Kylt® for detection/confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 cobas® SARS-CoV-2 (PCR) test TaqPath™ COVID-19 CE-IVD RT-PCR kit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Informed consent form signed and dated before any samples have been taken.
2. Suspected or confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection by PCR within the past five days.
3. Male and/or female patients aged 18 years and over.

facility.name: Instituto Nacional de Enfermedades Respiratorias Ismael Cosío Villegas

link.description: Click here to connect to Boehringer Ingelheim Clinical Studies Website
